title: The Learner's Development, Culture and Identity in Educational Settings
description: Theoretical background of child and early adolescent development within diverse cultural settings and implications for the teaching-learning process. Observations of children in everyday settings. 3 lectures, 1 activity. Participation in public schools requires mandated fingerprint clearance. Crosslisted as CD/EDUCÂ 207.
prerequisites: PSY 201 or PSY 202, or admission to the Multiple Subject Credential Program
